senses.de: An official document that gives you permission to own, do, or use something
senses.ex: She applied for a driver's license.

Tips.title: Required document
Tips.description: Think of 'license' as a key document that unlocks the right to do certain activities legally.
Tips.example: Without a business license, you cannot legally start a restaurant.

Tips.title: Official approval
Tips.description: 'License' implies government or authority approval, not just any informal permission.
Tips.example: You'll need a fishing license before you can legally fish in this lake.

Tips.title: Not indefinite
Tips.description: Licenses often have an expiration date after which they must be renewed.
Tips.example: Her driver's license expires next month and she needs to renew it.

senses.de: To give someone official permission to do something
senses.ex: The software is licensed to the company.

Tips.title: Formal permission
Tips.description: Using 'license' as a verb means to grant formal permission, often by an institution.
Tips.example: The new medicine was licensed by the health authorities.

Tips.title: Controlled allowance
Tips.description: 'Licensed' means allowed under control, not freely without any restrictions.
Tips.example: She is licensed to carry a concealed weapon.

senses.de: Freedom to behave as you wish, especially in a way which is not acceptable
senses.ex: He took that as a license to be rude.

Tips.title: Beyond rules
Tips.description: Here, 'license' refers to going beyond social or artistic norms, sometimes negatively.
Tips.example: His portrayal of the historical figure took too much artistic license, angering some critics.

Tips.title: Possible abuse
Tips.description: The noun can imply that someone might abuse a granted freedom.
Tips.example: Some worry that the new policy gives the police too much license.

Tips.title: Creative freedom
Tips.description: Artists often use 'license' to express personal interpretation or style.
Tips.example: The playwright used her poetic license to modernize Shakespeare's language.

Accreditation.wordDefinition:
Accreditation and license are two terms that are commonly used in different fields. Accreditation refers to the process by which an organization or institution is recognized as having met certain standards of quality, performance, and competency.

In simpler terms, accreditation is like a stamp of approval that an organization has met certain standards, while a license is a legal requirement that allows an individual or group to perform specific activities.

Approval.wordDefinition:
Approval refers to giving permission for something or agreeing that something is acceptable.

It is typically used for non-official matters, like getting your friend's approval for your outfit.

Approval is a more general term for giving permission, while a license is a specific legal document granting permission for a particular activity.

Authorization.wordDefinition:
Authorization and license are similar words that refer to permission to do something, but there are some differences.

Authorization typically means giving someone permission or power to do something on behalf of someone else, such as a company or government.

In simpler terms, authorization means permission to do something for someone else while a license is a legal agreement or document that allows you to do something, such as drive a car or own a business.

Certificate.wordDefinition:
A certificate is a document that proves you completed a course or training program. It shows that you have gained knowledge and skills in a particular area.

Certificates are generally given out after completing short courses, workshops, or training programs. For example, you might earn a certificate for completing a first aid course, or for learning how to use a specific computer program.

For example, you might need a license to drive a car, practice medicine, or operate heavy machinery. Licenses are typically more difficult to obtain than certificates, as they require passing a test or meeting certain qualifications.

In summary, certificates show that you have completed a course or training program, while licenses give you permission to perform a specific job or activity that requires specialized knowledge or skills.

Consent.wordDefinition:
Consent means giving permission for something to happen. It is applicable in situations where someone wants to do something to or with another person, and they need that person's permission first.

For example, if someone wants to give a hug to their friend, they need their friend's consent first.

Franchise.wordDefinition:
A franchise is a type of business that allows individuals to own and operate a business while using the trademark, products, and services of an established brand.

Essentially, a franchisee buys the right to use the name, concept, and products of a company for a certain period of time.

The difference between the two lies in the level of control and support provided by the parent company. In a franchise, the parent company provides support and guidance to the franchisee on how to run the business, including marketing, training, and supply chain management.

Franchises are often used in industries such as fast food, where a well-established brand and successful business model can be replicated across multiple locations.

Permit.wordDefinition:
A permit is also an official document, but it grants temporary permission to do something that would otherwise be restricted.

For example, a permit might be required to hold a special event in a public park or to build a fence on someone's property.

A license is more permanent and signifies that someone has met certain requirements, while a permit is more temporary and allows someone to do something specific for a limited time.

Sanction.wordDefinition:
Sanction refers to the action taken by a governing body to impose a penalty or punishment for violating a law or rule.

Sanctions can include fines, suspension, or other consequences.

Sanction can also refer to the approval or endorsement of a particular action, such as a government sanctioning a military operation.

License is about giving permission, while sanction is about imposing consequences. License is applicable when someone needs permission or authorization to do something, while sanction is applicable when someone has violated a law or rule and needs to be punished.

Warrant.wordDefinition:
A warrant is a legal order issued by a court or other authority giving permission to law enforcement to take certain actions, like conducting a search or making an arrest.

Warrants are issued when there is probable cause to believe that a crime has been committed and that evidence or a suspect can be found in a particular place.

A license gives permission to do something that would normally be restricted, while a warrant gives permission to law enforcement to take certain actions in the pursuit of justice.

quotes.Text: But one of the most enjoyable things for me is that running for office gives you this license to enter the world of somebody else and to hear about the dreams that they have for themselves, for their family, for the country.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Julian Castro

quotes.Text: Acting is not hiding to me; it's revealing. We give you license to feel. 'Hey, she's crying, so it's okay if I cry, too.' That's the most important thing in the world, because when you stop feeling, that's when you're dead.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Loretta Swit

quotes.Text: My dad was known as a mean guy. He never smiled, and he had 'Mr. Mean' put on his license plate. But he was one of the neighborhood dads who looked out for everyone. He would take kids in and help them out.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Gary Payton

quotes.Text: If you operate a TV or radio station, you have to have a license. It has nothing to do with fundamental freedom. It has to do with protection of the average citizen against abuses.
quotes.Title: Belgian Scientist
quotes.Name: Robert Cailliau

quotes.Text: Typically, if you buy a studio with a library, their library is pretty well licensed out many years in advance, so you are not really gaining access to the programming in that way.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Ted Sarandos

quotes.Text: Traditionally, I have no right to talk about race. I'm white; I didn't grow up in an all-black neighborhood. But the license I see for myself is I'm a member of the world.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Sarah Silverman

quotes.Text: You have license in front of the camera to do things, feel certain emotions that you don't get to in real life. It can be addicting.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Sebastian Stan

quotes.Text: Call a man 'ignorant,' and you have license to show the world your vast fund of knowledge and wise him up.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.Text: I believe you should have a world where you've got to license something at a fair price.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Steve Wozniak

quotes.Text: Do I support a driver's license for everybody? The answer is yes.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Gavin Newsom
